answers.answer: Try a hot or cold compresses. I eat almonds. It seems to work
I know you say without meds bit have you tried Tylenol?Otherwise just lots of hydration. Typically pregnancy headaches are caused by tension. Try getting a massage

If you have constant headaches that don't go away, even at some point without Tylenol, you should get your blood pressure checked. Frequent headaches can be a sign of hypertension- which in esp in pregnancy can be dangerous. It's linked to preeclampsia.  Call your doctor asap. Better to be safe then sorry

Thanks for the responses everyone I'll try the Tylenol if it gets too bad I just hate taking meds besides vitamins while pregnant. @shannir I have posted those on my handy notes in case they come back. Allid32 I will contact my doctor and make sure she knows what's going on so we can avoid the hyoertention because I don't need that happening. Thanks bunches ladied

My doctor suggested a little bit of caffeine like a small cup of coffee/tea or a can of coke. It did wonders and I still do a few sips of coca cola when I get a bad headache so I won't have to take meds.

question: Hello everyone I'm 15 weeks and I have been having headaches almost everyday. They are so bad that I can't work has anyone experienced this and have you found a way to stop the headaches without taking meds?
title: constant headaches
